placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Adren alin, Fun and Fun
text: Get away from the city and splash yourslef. also enjoy some Adrenalin games. If you love animals you may book for lion view.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: The kids will love it! Family Perfect!
text: The Lion Park Resort has rides young people will very much enjoy. Also there are actual lion family there, dad, mom and triplets, 2 boys and a girl. Gaborone is hot especially in summer so the pool with slide is awesome. For adults I recommend the roller coaster and paintball. You can also have braai or barberque. Its the perfect family spot with everything for everyone. They used to have horses next door but unfortunately there are no longer there.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Expectations, expectations
text: We took a day trip to Lion Park resort with the hope of spending a fun family day out. We were happy to be offered a “Winter Special” discount and managed to save on the entry fee. However we were disappointed to see that half of the rides were not working including the main water slide which “did not have water supply”. The rides looked old and worn out and the place rather quiet with limited catering although you are allowed to bring your own food for a fee. Notwithstanding this we enjoyed seeing the lion though. It was generally a very disappointing outing. This place does have the potential to better if management invests in repair and rehabilitation of the rides and general facilities.

ownerResponse.title: Owner Response
ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your review of our facility. As mentioned by you, your visit to our facility was during the Winter Special. The discounted entrance fees are available during the Winter Special, due to the fact that we close the pools and slides for the winter period. At the same time we perform maintenance on the amusement rides, since winter is our low season. These maintenance activities do result in the closure of some of the amusement rides.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Best Place for team building
text: We had a fabulous time with full free wifi (cellphone coverage is not that good). The food was excellent. The facilities were very good and the lion viewing was the highlight of the day. The evening braai was not a braai at all but just dinner. This should be improved. because we were the only people there a bit of music would have not been bad. otherwise the place is very accommodating as some of my collogues say they left the place very late but no one bothered them.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: entertaining for kids, great family outing
text: wonderful, great activities and rides for kids, food available though costly, good for families and picnincs

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Fun Place
text: there are lots of activities to do there and kids activities, which provides a good family outing place

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Astonishing tourist attraction
text: The entrance fee was well worth it.  Although it was cold, we couldn't believe that such a GEM could exist!  It was wonderful to see the lions and the guide was very helpful on all questions raised.  I think it is a must visit during the summer months!  The park is clean and we would love to enjoy the rides when it is warmer!

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: INTERESTING AREA FOR KIDS, NOT WELL MAINTAINED FACILITIES
text: Interesting place, we started with  a train ride, then viewing of lions was actually fun, one named Shumba marked it's territory in front of us as if to show us who is boss. The rides paints was worn out, Pools were not cleaned, even though it is winter.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: A must visit tourist spot.
text:
I have been to this place several times in my 20 years of Gaborone life and Lion's park just 15 km from Gaborone.
Eventhough a lot of additions have been made over the years i hav always enjoyed this place where you can go with your gamily and friends even before as there are not a lot of places like this in Botswana.The entrance fee is very reasonable and you dont need to pay anything inside for the different type of rides/ games you play. You are tied a band which is valid for a day so if you want you can go out and come in any number of yimes within that day so we being vegetarians we cook and take our food and go around 10 as soon as its open spend a lot of time in valley of waves where every 25 minutes there is an artificial wave which is really excellent  (very smaller version of sun city's valley of waves) and hav lunch in our car around 1 in the afternoon and then go back enjoy different games and leave by 6pm.Even though all rides are interesting the roller coaster and valley of waves and the other one which you walk to the top and come throgh a open tunnel in a zig zag manner and finally land into the water are three most interesting ones.Of course to see the lion also is interesting.
There is nice bar and coffee shop and icecream shops as well as the ice creams sold in 3 wheels also. It is a lovely place to see.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: What a wonderful Park it is!
text:
The park has quite a number of games. The train ride is good for family and takes you around the park. The roller coaster is so crazy, the minute it departed from the platform I knew I made a mistake being on board! but with a couple of minutes ( which seemed like forever) it was all over.

The place is like 15 mins outside town. The road leading to the facility needs to be upgraded and so is the parking. Staff is always ready to assist and speak English too. There is a bonus of viewing lions in the premise. However they were just sleeping the whole time , no matter the screams we threw at them.
Overall, this is a fantastic park to take the kids for fun.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Family outing spot just outside Gaborone
text: A great place for a family picnic, with a nice campsite for those who may want to spend the night, just bring your camping equipment and book a campsite. Also great for day visits with family, they have e few rides, roller coster and a small man made beach...

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Magic place to spend a day with the family.
text: Spent the day there with the family that we visiting me from the UK, with the heat here in Botswana a water-park is just what they needed. Food and drinks are available and reasonably priced. Could have done with the music not being so loud as people do like to sit around and chat.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Surpriced to find such a place here
text: On the way back from Lobatse I first saw the rollercoaster and then the road sign. I had to pull in. Lunch was a T-Bone steak and salad with a Malawian Special. The steak took more than 40 minutes to get to my table and I walked around and took some photos. The 1 ride looks very familiar from my young boy days but just maybe it can't be or can it? The Dancer. The venue is large and over space for functions and conferances. The steak and salad was fine.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: The best kept secret in Botswana - Camping with style
text: Although about 10km out of Gabs this is the place to camp.  Dedicated shaded hard pads for caravans/motorhomes additional powered campsites for tents etc.  Immaculate facilities and green grass.  Primo Brie for each site with wood supplied.  Also free access to the park.  A little noisey during the day but only the roar of the lions during the nigh. We stayed a week and a bit and enjoyed every minute of our stay.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Wonderful, enjoyable day!
text:
Our family visited Lion Park to give the children something enjoyable to do for their mid-term break. It wasn’t the first time that we visited the park (we always enjoy it there), but what I want to emphasize with this review is the amazing friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. When we arrived there wasn’t a table available for us, due to a conference being hosted. The waitress promptly organized a table  -  being very friendly the whole time. Later the day (around 12o clock) we went to see the lions. The guide cheerfully answered all our questions, made jokes, (even giving us more information about wildlife in general) and made the short trip memorable for the children. Last, but not least, earlier in the morning the children took a ride on the small ‘train’. One of the children forgot his towel on the train. About an hour later the operator/attendant of the train came looking for my boy, holding a towel, that my boy forgot whilst riding on the train. Wow...! 
I sincerely want to thank you, because a place can be well-maintained, and run like an oiled machine, but if the staff is surly, a family day-out can be ruined. Thank you!!

ownerResponse.title: Owner Response
ownerResponse.text:
Morning,

Thank you very much for your review. We appreciate positive feedback because it enables us to recognise employees, whom excel at their duties.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Bonesang's 1st Bithday Party
text: The service was okay, looking at the fact that the Park was packed. Overall it was fun and memorable.

ownerResponse.title: Owner Response
ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your review. I have to agree with you, our service was not what it was supposed to be with regard to birthday parties for the weekend of Saturday, 23 September. The Lion Park Resort, hosted a Family Fun Day on this day and we had a big number of birthday parties on the same day. During our operational review meeting on 26 September, it was decided that the number of birthday parties will be limited on days coinciding with special events like Family Fun Days. This is to ensure that you get the service you deserve. We are very sorry if we disappointed you.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Run down low maintained amusement park
text: The lion park offers a large swimming pool, slides and an amusement park. It also offers conference rooms. We were here with the children as we wanted to discover all the things to see and to around Gaborone. We noticed a lot of litter and debris in the amusement park lying around. Parts of the pavement were washed away and caved in. The roller coaster didn't look like it was maintained in the last decade (we later learned that one of our friends kids got stuck in there, hanging upside down...) The pool and slides were the only place where our children had some fun, but the swimming pool was not very clean. We also went to see the lions, but for me I don't like seeing lions in caged surroundings. Ticket price is reasonable compared to European standards, but high to local standards. I would not recommend this place, there are many other things to do and see in Botswana. This place is more for the residents to go to as a place to celebrate birthday parties or a family picnic.

ownerResponse.title: Owner Response
ownerResponse.text:
I would like to thank you for your review of our facility. You have clearly spent time, compiling your review. I would have appreciated the opportunity to respond to some of your allegations before you used a public platform to publicise your review. However, let me try my best to respond to your review.

1.	Your friend is not telling the truth, if she states that her “kids got stuck in there, hanging upside down…”. The roller coaster has NEVER, during its time with us, been stuck or stopped on any section of the free running track of the ride. This includes the vertical loop, which is the only section on the ride where the rider is inverted.
2.	The roller coaster was installed 6 years ago and it is maintained by an experienced maintenance team. The only problem we have is the paint, which was used to repaint the steel track during installation of the roller coaster. The new paint started to lift in sections about 1 year ago. This lifting is caused by a compatibility problem with the paint previously applied to the ride and aggravated by the harsh sunlight experienced in Botswana.
3.	We have cared for our lions since they had been rescued as cubs. Their enclosure is 11,700m2, which is most certainly not a cage. We’ve acted responsibly by having the 3 male lions undergo vasectomies. Resulting in them being able to perform the act needed to procreate without inseminating the 2 lionesses.
4.	I cannot agree with your statement, that the swimming pool water was not clean. The wave pool is our pride and the joy of our visitors. We are very meticulous about the quality of the water in our pools.
5.	The washed away paving; was an old storm water drain, which were damaged during a massive rain storm. The area is well demarcated, preventing customers access to the area. To date, designs for a new drain had been completed with an ongoing tender process for the construction of a new storm water drain.

ownerResponse.title: Owner Response
ownerResponse.text:
Good day Binolo.

Thank you for your review of our facility. The Lion Park Resort is not a facility, which take customers on tours. Our water park and amusement park are to be explored by our customers at their own leisure. The only tour on offer is a guided tour to our lions. It is my understanding that you did not select this option. 

Food for birthday parties are prepared according to the guest list provided by you. It is your responsibility to notify us in advance of changes to your guest list, which will result in changes in quantities of meals prepared.

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: fun time
text: fun activities for the whole family and the resturant serves good food. the only problem is that it is not easily accesible using public transport

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: EXPERIENCE LION PARK
text: Though It was windy and a bit cold for the kids, The service received was very good and I would recommend the venue for other activities. I will definitely be back!

placeInfo.name: Lion Park Resort
placeInfo.address: Portion 184, Portion 12 Crocodile Pools No. 15-KO, Gaborone Botswana

title: Wonderful day out
text: This place may divide people, but we absolute loved it. They have done up the viewing hides so they are really very nice. Wildlife will depend on when you go, but in November we saw lots of wildebeest, jackals, and different birds. The horizon was pink with flamingoes and pelicans in the pan. I’m guessing some people might drive in and wonder what all the fuss is about as it’s a flat plain with some wildebeest , but if you take the time and give this community run place a chance it is really very special :)

title: Probably better in the wet season
text: This time of year the birds are few and far between.  We did get lovely shots of a mated pair of Ostrich.  The rosy spoonbills were in action as well.  We could see how great it would be here when it’s wet!

title: Brilliant place, great birds, wildlife and landscape.
text:
Always a great visit, but this time (August 2022) the pans were full of water. We've seen a few pelicans and flamingos here before, but this year the pan had hundreds of pelicans and other birds. They were fishing in large "rafts" close to shore. We also had good sightings of Kori Bustard and antelopes.

Don't use the viewing platform, it is no longer safe. But it's not necessary.

Friendly staff at the reception. We used the toilets then drove out to the pans. The roads were dry and OK (Fortuner 4x4, but a normal car is OK when it is dry).

We had excellent lunch at nearby Nata Lodge, also great place to stay.

title: Winter visit review!
text: We didn't saw a single bird! No, I am exagerating, there were about 12, including 3 pelicans, but not more than that. I'm sure it's completely different in the wet season, at least, I do hope so.

title: It was awful
text:
The sign at the gate clearly says no picnics. I certainly have no issues with a picnic, but we were met at the viewing tower with about 50 people falling around with loud music and bottles of alcohol everywhere. It seems to be a good weekend spot for some of the people living in Nata for an excursion. I would not come over a weekend. It was unpleasant and considering the pans were full of water, it was the only place to get close to the pans. So we basically drove in, saw some Wildebeest on the way in, no birds and a hoard of drunk people hogging the only viewing site.
At the gate the lady did say that there were many Motswana inside, but we should try and find a spot for ourselves. I didn’t know what she meant by the comment until we reached the pans. My family were very disappointed in the experience and from arriving at the gate and leaving it was less than an hour. A waste of time and money on this occasion.

title: Visit the salt pans
text: Took an afternoon self drive with my parents and some friends. Made it to the watch tower very easily and enjoyed a lunch there whilst overlooking the salt pans. They are currently full of water so you cannot go onto them. Saw some pelicans but flamingos are not yet there due to water being too high. Also saw some wildebeest. Lovely day trip and well worth the visit if you’ve never been before. If you don’t want to drive there yourself or do not feel your vehicle will make the dirt road you can book a trip with Nata Lodge and you can go in one of their vehicles

title: Wet and wild
text: Highly recommended.  BUT if there's water (like NOW) only a 4x4.  Eish - had some scary moments but it was a most amazing day! Enjoy the photos and little video.  Just a small "puddle" - YES ONE OF THE SMALLER ONES - and made a few ostridge and wildebeest mad :) (no animals were hurt!)

title: Few birds, interesting salt pan
text: We visited mid February and there were very few birds. The lake was still dry, but the road was full of water pools. It was impossible to pass with a normal car and our Landcruiser could just make it. We could easily be stuck in one of the many deep water pools in the road. It was impressive to see the salt lake, but we only saw a few birds and no flamingos or pelicans. The ranger informed us in advance that there were few birds and the road was next to impassable.

title: More than first meets the eye
text: Although the entrance fee is quite stiff, if you look at the park with interested eyes, there is a lot to see and take in. Whilst the animals are limited to gnus, zebras, springbuck, and ostriches, seeing an ostrich nest up close is a bonus. Also the greater flamingo and pelicans were in attendance at the pans apart from other birds like the corry buzzard. Of course the pans and their history and the glorious sunsets round of a well worthwhile day.

title: Not worth the money
text:
We have not seen much.
It was a big dissappointment.
The thing that was most impressive was the sunset in the dry river bed.

title: Surreal
text: Although it is called a bird sanctuary there were no flamingo or pelicans there at the end of the dry season. We saw pelicans at the Makgadigadi National Park. The salt pans are amazing and the sunset over the salt pans is surreal. Also the plant that grows there, the hoodia, which is protected in Botswana,  is allegedly good for reducing weight without exercise.

title: even w/o birds worth to look at
text: came there during very dry period so no birds such as flamingos. nevertheless the pans are breathtaking itself and worts a trip. did also a ride to the big pothole which was quite adventurous. definitely a must do

title: Very impressive
text: We visited this huge sanctuary at sunset and were overwhelmed by the thousands of flamingos. An very impressive spectacle. Otherwise we didn't see many birds.

title: Interesting Visit- Worth a Detour
text:
Came for a quick visit during the rainy season, and I say quick because the roads turn to quicksand and vehicles get stuck.

Saw wildebeests, buffalo, and many bird species including flamingo and storks. The salt pans themselves are hauntingly beautiful and incredibly interesting.
I also love the fact that this reserve has been handed over to the local village for management and a share in the profits.

title: Great place to watch birds
text: There is a variety of birds in this park, even in dry season. You can also find wildebeest and other antelopes here.

title: A lake in the desert
text:
Close to Nata is the Bird sanctuary. In the desert and salt pans you find this salt pan with thousands of Pelicans and Flamingos.
An amazing spectacle

title: Loved it, just loved it
text:
Great afternoon driving through nata bird sanctuary along with the delta a real highlight from our 10 days in Botswana.

Game drive was interesting did get to see a few animals and birds before we got to salt flats.

Once we got to salt flats near sunset it was amazing lots of birds including a few flamingos (most were on other side of lake due to breeding patterns).

Great to walk along the sands and watch the birds, we did walk out in water a few hundred metres it’s about ankle high.

Then watch sunset with a drink in your hand simply amazing experience.

title: Worth a quick visit if you're in the area.
text: We were fortunate enough to visit while there was some water in the pan - there were thousands of flamingo's and what a lovely experience this was! There are many larger and more interesting game reserves in Botswana but we do recommend a visit here if you are passing. The entry costs go to the local community we were told so your visit will make a difference in more ways than one.

title: A gem!!!!
text: Awesome salt pan drive. It is now my top sunset spot. Its a pity we only saw wild beasts, zebras, flamingos, and other birds. but the landscape is unique and beautiful.

title: Excellent experience
text: One of the great wonders of our planet these pans are a must see. Reasonable entry fee into the sanctuary and the pans. The rains have been poor this year so we had to travel about 7 km to find the first water. No Flamingos, but plenty of other birds to see. We also saw a lot of Wildebeest. No other animals unfortunately. We went for the sunset, which was an excellent experience. World class experience on one of the worlds largest pans.

title: quick visit
text: Here you will have a very nice experiance on the pans with ample bird life and wild life to see and some mud holes as well to enjoy if that is your take

title: Sunset watching the birds
text: We watched the birds for quite a long time and watched the sunset here.  It was magical seeing the flamingos and pelicans.

title: Poor management
text:
We were highly disappointed! We called to have details of the time and payment and the lady was not able to help and gave us a number that was not answering...
We went the next day with dollars/euros/rands but the lady at the front office did not want them (only pula) and later admitted that she was not working here usually...
When we managed to get hold of the manager (on our own airtime) she spoke to the lady at the front office to accept our rands but the exchange rate was a scam (820 instead of 630..).
We called back but the manager never picked up the phone anymore. She then sent a message saying «  the customers are always right but sometimes not ».
A real shame...

title: Great Birding
text: Nata bird sanctuary is a great example of community-led conservation and offers a truly amazing birding experience and landscape. A must do for the keen twitcher, I saw eastern clapper lark,  great white pelican and pink-backed pelican, hottentot teal,  black-chested snake-eagle, northern black-bellied korhaan, African fish eagle among others

title: Visit to Nata Bird Sanctuary
text: Our visit was amazing. Lots of water in the pans and could see lots of birds on the pans as well as other wild. Management makes it so easy for travelers to visit the pans without any delay. Very good project. Lady at reception friendly and very informative.

title: Bird Watching
text: Viewing platform +/-7km from entrance. Road in teasonable condition and accessable with 2x4 vehicle (needs to high). Impressive variety of waders viz. flamingos, pelicans, stilts, plovers, lapwings, ducks, korhaan, etc. Large flocks of pelican and flamingos can be seen at the river mouth. Wildebees and Zebra are to be seen on the pans. A worthwhile diversion when passing by.

title: Salt pans or lake!
text: The surprise of the visit was the expectation of flat dry salt pans, only to find a vast lake instead. To be honest their were still large tracts of salt pan but the previous year's cyclone in Mozambique dumped a lot of rain in Botswana. Another big plus was the massive colonies of flamingos and pelicans due to the water. It's a must visit.

title: " Poor Experience "
text: Paid good money for a Safari into the sanctuary but alas only 6 individual birds ,some Flamingos, horses and off in the distance Zebras and Wildebeeste .  The Guide must have know about the lack of Wildlife but they still took our money,,,,felt very ripped off.  Forget it see more birdlife along the highway as you drive from place to place

title: Vast landscape
text: Great views over Sowa pan, part of Greater Makgadikgadi Pans. Several viewing platforms in need of repair. Saw large flocks of greater flamingoso and pelicans.  Also a hyena lurking in the undergrowth.  Lovely sunset.

title: Very interesting landscape
text:
The salt pans and grasslands are quite a sight to behold. Completely flat, so you can see animals far away.

At this time of the year, the larger pans are flooded which draws a lot of birds (flamingos, pelicans, avocets, stilts etc).

Great place to have a beer for sunset

title: A birders paradise
text:
This is a must for bird watchers. There were many pans in various stages of drying up following the wet season. There were many Pelicans and Flamingos as well as other water birds.

In the surrounding areas there are various animals, including Blue Wildebeests and Jackals.

Most of the roads are easily traversible, but be aware that at the time I was there many roads disappeared into the pans.

title: Worth visit, even more so when the flamingos are there
text: The Nata Bird sanctuary is worth a visit as you get to see part of the Makgadikgadi pans. We saw a lot of bird life such us flamingos, pelicans and others. There were only a few flamingos but I’m sure when the large numbers that they get are there it must be an amazing sight. The roads aren’t to bad but the viewing platform is not very sturdy and needs some maintenance.

title: Lots of animals and birds
text: We saw lots of animals and birds during our safari in the sanctuary, including an Aardwolf.  The sunset was spectacular.

title: Nothing Special and overpriced.
text:
I drove down from Elephant Sands to the Nata bird sanctuary in the hope of seeing a variety of birds, The entrance fee is a steep BWP135 (I am a foreigner and was riving aa SA registered rental) for what was no more than a possible 7.5kms worth of drivable roads. 

The Sua pan was full of water and I did see a few pelicans and some other birds but zero sight of the famous flamingos.  

If you happen to be passing via Nata then you could stop here for a couple of hours but bear in mind the steep entrance price - you pay per car and per passenger as well.

I would not make a special trip just to see Nata Bird Sanctuary,

A word of caution, do not underestimate the road - a slight spot of brown colouration should read danger. I saw some Swiss tourists drive through the not so dry road and they were bogged in very quickly,

As a side note, they do have their own camping site which I drove around and it was truly in a sad state with not a single site occupied,

title: Very warm during the day
text:
Enroute from Kama Rhino Sanctuary to Kasane and into Zambia. Just one night. Very hot and during the serious drought of 2013 -17, no birds of note and the pans were 100% dry, as was the Nata river.

Camp had good water, showers and WC's, nice cooking areas for each site, but little shade during the day.  All the same, a nice place to spend the night

Travel was in October 2016, not 17

title: Pans
text: You cannot visit Nata and not take a trip onto the pans, its almost like being on a beach at the seaside.

title: good
text: the dried out salt lake was full of water when we were there in December, Lot's of flamingo's and pellicans seen

title: Flamingos was there!!
text:
Although there is only said the time to see the flamingo is around December til February we saw a lot of flamingos, the greater and the lesser flamingo! That was amazing! A great place to be, to get an impression of the pans, the lake there and the wideness with lots of animals like the gnu, the austrich, the steinbock besides the birds. It was really worth to do it!!!!
We went there in the early morning round 8 o clock and had a good time there, from 10 o clock its getting really hot the last october days.... if you like to get out of the car, it is necessary to wear long trousers and good shoes. The grass is quite stingy.

title: Another Must Visit Place
text: We visited again last weekend en route home to SA & we were totally taken aback at the amount of water in the pans - on our last visit in 2013 the roads to the pans were wet but there was very little water in the large pan at the lookout hide. We saw huge flocks of Flamingoes & many Pelicans amongst many other birds - a wonderful place to pass the day!

title: Look, look and look some more
text: The expanse of the place!  Miles & miles of flat grasslands, salt pans and salty, grey water - well worth seeing.  Although the birds had not yet arrived in their hundreds and thousands we were so glad to have visited the Sanctuary - don't miss it.  Even although the season really dictates how much you will see it is well worth a visit at any time of the year.

title: Poor during our visit
text: We visited the bird sanctuary and there was not much to see during our late August visit. The site is still nice for a sunset drink.

title: Place to go for bird watchers, for others spend more time in Kasane
text: If you are a bird watcher, or if you are camping and need a daytrip you can go the the Nata Bird Sanctuary. It is not on my definitely to do list when in Botswana. Must see is: Kasane, Chobe river cruise, A safari trip in Chobe park as early as possible, Vic Falls and a night under the stars at Makgadigadi pans. Those are an absolute must.

title: No staff but plenty of flamingoes and pelicans
text: There was nobody at the gate at opening time so we went into the sanctuary regardless and paid upon exiting to the apathetic reception lady. The birding was amazing and the pans were full to the brim there was even a small congregation of zebras and wildebeest on the way to the platform.

title: you have to be there at the right time
text: Obviously at some times of the year there should be a lot of flamingos, pelicans or big herds of grazers here, but not when i was there in the beginning of july. The sanctuary is relatively small and you can drive all the available dirt roads in several hours. The north western route to the bird hide is very eroded, real 4x4 strongly recommended.

title: Unexpected huge lake
text: The view deck is nice however totally not maintained so climb on own risk. Unfortunately we did not spot any bird - perhaps due to the timing (July, 0900 AM)

title: Fantastic
text: A wonderful experience. The pans were full of water and we saw a wolf on the pans. The flamingoes had just arrived and a whole flock took off and flew over us. It was amazing! Sunset was spectacular with pelicans just floating around on the water. Guide was great and explained things well. Not to be missed expereince.

title: Awesome wildlife
text: This is a great drive for birders. Fantastic sightings and fabulous sunsets. Knowledgeable guides, amazing seeing the pan full of water.

title: Perfect
text:
A must see!! You will not regret it! 
Being there in between noghingness 
Only water or just plain dust blowing over the dry crust! 
Rainy seasons provide millions of flamingos! 
Stunning view! 
But in the dry season it turns to dust and is an incredible experience!* where you feel like you are the only person in the entire world! Breathtaking experience!

title: Poor value for money (PRICES INCLUDED)
text:
We came here when staying down the road from there and not having much else to do in the area.

Entrance cost 55.00BWP per person + 30.00BWP for the car!

The road is poorly maintained and we had scratches on the side of the car from the thorny bushes. 

We barely seen any birds or animals and felt like we've been ripped off.

You'll see loads of birds and animals anywhere else but here.

title: Good to see the pan
text:
We took an afternoon game drive, organised by Nata lodge. I think our guide was taking his exams, as he seemed a bit nervous and we were accompanied by a second guide, who seems more experienced and was quietly in the background, listening to everything our guide said. Due to this exam, our guide to-be was keen on sharing all the information he had in him and that was a fun and interesting experience. He told u things that weren't necessarily pertinent to the actual sighting, so we learned a lot. I am sure once this guide will had a bit of a routine, he will be great.
Being in the sanctuary gives you a good insight of what the pans look like, and which animals and plants grow there. The flamingo's hadn't arrived yet, due to the high amount of water that was still in the pans, but we did see a few pelicans. The sunset was just spectacular and the (salt)lake at the platform location had a wonderful and strange image of disappearing in the sky on the horizon. We also saw some bigger game (zebra, springbok, wildebeest) and nocturnal animal on our way back to the exit. I would recommend a guide as I didn't see any signing in the park.

title: Fun and exquisite
text: My 2nd home! I love this place for its lush flora in the backyard and kind staff. The outside bar area by the pool is splendid with the new seating arrangements.

title: awesome
text: it was a very pleasant environment with friendly staff i could not complain.I would not mind visiting the place again

title: Day out
text: Its a decent place if you want to relax away from home. And there is a range of food and drinks one can have by the poolside.

title: Avani Hotel
text: The hotel location is very good and can be accessed easily. There are certain things i found wanting in that hotel such as the level of cleanliness and the fact that you cannot freely bring food of your choice to the hotel yet they do not offer any better alternative. I found such arrangement to be ackward and not necessary!!

title: The place is very beautiful and the atmosphere is very good. It have good gardens.
text: The staff is very friendly and they offer a very good service. This place also offers entertainment like casino and they also have atm machines in house for those who can need cash. the place is also very secure and is strategically located not far from a number of malls.

title: Valentine's special
text: Avani as it is now known, is such an elegant place with great service. Had a mouth watering dinner at their Savuti restaurant for valentine's day. We were welcomed with a glass of champagne by the entrance and there was also great live music performance. The whole set-up of the event was magnificent and to die for.

title: Avani
text:
Gaborone Sun is now known as the Avani. An excellent, elegant hotel. 
Has a pool which is wonderful in the summer months.

title: breakfast, morning
text: Friendly staff, great coffee and snack at the new renovated coffee shop, the new Mosha Spa retreat is also outstanding. Definitely a place to go for a meal and relax, its a great space .

title: OK Place to Stay
text:
I have been staying here for a number of years and whilst Avani have done a number of things to improve the hotel there is still some way to go.
Mahogany's needs a complete revamp. Quality of food isn't great, waiting time to receive food is very slow. You need to have specials.
Rooms need to be available at check in time.
Very young staff, many trainees who don;t seem to know what they are doing.
Despite me being signed up to the loyalty  program  I have never received anything! And have sent many e-mails.

title: We had a wedding celebration at the hotel. The event started very late due to late preparations by the hotel.
text: Otherwise the place is good for any event as long as the management can improve on service delivery. The food was delicious and there was variety.

title: Revision
text: This is not a review but to inform you that this establishment has since changed its name to Avani Gaborone, Resort and Casino.

title: Comfortable Stay
text:
The stay at Gaborone Sun now known as Avani Gaborone Resort & Sun was comfortable from the prespective of the room. Being a vegetarian I struggled with food as variety was lacking and seemed like food was repeated. In toom.dining was not the best.

Breakfast seemed lacking as well.
The Pantry which is a shop at the hotel had decent smacks.  For meat eaters there is sufficient variety.

Has a gym facility and pool. There is also a casino for those avid gamblers.

title: Average ....
text: There was a rowdy andclient who was drunk and kept on disturbing other guests  the waiters continued to serve him drinks . We had to wait a very long time to be assisted

title: Vacation
text: Nice outdoor and relaxing place. Poolside has a nice view and the lawn is always up to date and well taken care of. The refreshments bar is also well set up strategically

title: A great place
text: Had a surprise birthday here, staff came to sing for me. For the first time in my life I cried. It was the best gift I ever had, the food are superb. Will frequent them thereafter, even their casinos, I had time to waste few coins on. The cheap beer, great people to hang with. It’s one of those places one must visit when in Gaborone.

title: it was distasteful
text: there was no hot water in winter and the staff customer service is just horrific. I took pictures of an uncovered ironing board that was dirty

title: Great service!
text: Absolutely lovely place, visited there several times.  No place could win it where I have been visiting.

title: One of the best Hotel Resort and Casino's in Gaborone
text:
Actually it is no longer Gaborone Sun it is AVANI hotel resort and casino.
It is a very good place in the heart of Gaborone.Previously as it was a part of Sun group of Sun city even now they helo you to assist in checking the bookings at the four hotels (cabanas, main hotel, cascades and THE PALACE) in sun city.
The restaurant serves buffet lunch and Dinner throughout the week except lunch time on Saturday's at that time usually they clean the restaurant.The rooms are really clean and good enough and the room service is really great.In short the house keeping is good.on the back of the restaurant there is a nice grassy place neatly maintained with playing area for children and sitting area for adults.all facilities are available in this huge hotel it is a good place to relax.

title: Cosy Place to unwind
text: I had a wonderful time at Grand Palm as i celebrated my birthday there, Bai Sheng Restaurant food was Scrumptious i enjoyed the fried rice and stir fry chicken plus the welcome green tea. How ever the room service lady who assisted me for breakfast nearly spoilt my stay. Otherwise thumbs up Grandpalm.

title: A beautiful location in the heart
text: Kind staff, wonderful location. I'd travel there again if given the opportunity. Be sure to pack snacks.

title: Great ambiance
text: We visited with the family after having been there a few years earlier and were not disappointed. The Service, food and accommodation were top class.

title: Took several guests to dinner at the main Avani restaurant.
text: The food was ordinary, and the service at Botswana standard.  The kitchen need to improve significantly if it wants to be highly regarded.  The dining room was not full, which was also indicative.

title: Ms
text:
Please take note the name has changed to Avani Gaborone Hotel & Casino

Refurbishing done. Beautiful, peaceful ambience. Attentive and friendly staff who will go out of their way to assist and accommodate your needs. 
Come visit The Pantry for sinful nibbles and drinks. The two in-house restaurants, Savuti, Mahogony’s and the Pool Bar will cater to your needs with a wide variety of food.

title: Äving fun at Avani!
text: Great central location, the refurbishment was well worth the expense! The waiters at the pool terrace restaurant are a little slow on the uptake. They take ages to bring orders even when the place is not busy. The buffet in the restaurant has a great spread of dishes ranging from Chinese, Indian and traditional Botswana cuisine.

title: Gaborone Sun hotel
text: The hotel provide value for money for the business traveler and good food at the restaurant. Wifi reception needs improvement

title: Gaborone Sun/Avani near Gaborone Golf course
text: We stayed in Avani (previously Gaborone Sun, but everybody still calls it that, even taxi drivers) in February 2016 with our children while we were looking for housing in Gaborone. It's a nice hotel and they have done a lot of revamping. The rooms are spacious, the beds are very comfortable and they have connecting rooms (nice when travelling with kids under 18). The hotel swimming pool is clean and the pool area is a nice place to eat and have a drink. Since February 2016 it even has improved a lot in August 2017 and I visited an art gallery night here. Next door you will find the Gaborone Golf Course for those who love to bring their golf clubs.  The rooms are quite expensive, there are more affordable places in town if you are on a budget. Just check the booking sites for a favourable price. The hotel organises quite a few events and the poolbar is the place to go on a Friday night.

title: Gaborone sun/ Avani Gaborone
text:
This hotel is in a major renovation. Great improvements are ongoing! looking forward to its completion!!
Great spot!

title: owners changed quite a time ago and not for the better
text: Spend the New Year Eve there, not bad, typical hotel food, definitely the old owners were more dedicated regarding food, welcome, service, etc. Low quality speakers on the music side were humming all the time, you could not hear the music payed.

title: the place is surely gonna look awesome...........the best the city have ever had..no doubt
text: great staff, from the security personnel, the potters ,the ladies at the reception oh their smiles. i felt like i was home . everyone knew me by name. quite place if you want to enjoy some quality time alone.

title: Good to bad to....
text: Used to be a good hotel once. Now it is worth a miss. The food, the stay, the rooms are all on the way down.

title: Great food, excellent customer service
text: Great customer service. smiley staff members and most importantly great food. They respond very fast to customer requests.  Coming back for more excellent service from them.

title: A Touch of Class
text: A beautiful place with great tasty foods of great varieties. I love their buffets. Wonderful accommodation as well as conferencing facilities.

title: Modern hotel  with great innovation in terms of service. Cuisine is amazing and caters to a variety of tastes
text: Conveniently situated in Gaborone for business and pleasure. One of the best hotels available in the city

title: brilliant oasis
text: Have stayed at the Gaborone Sun many, many times  - a real oasis of an hotel. Many fond memories shared with my children and family. Brilliant buffet for evening meal and breakfast, can not fault the service. Highly recommend to all travellers to the capital.

title: accomadation
text: is very beautiful hotel with so much entertainment in it, talk about the casino you got it, spa also there, a bar and a pool area as well.

title: Happy bour
text: Good cocktail menu and food with reasonable price. Customer care is super great. It is my usual spot, and i love it

title: tranquil calm and relaxing
text: spacious rooms, fantastic breakfast spread, lovely cocktails/mocktails at the pool, very clean and friendly staff

title: Mrs Lizah Gondwe
text:
Gaborone Sun is a very popular hotel and a meeting place in Gaborone City , Botswana which has maintained very high  standards over the years 

We had a social meeting with friends and the service at  the terrace was quite good and to our expectations 

The waiter kept a close watch to our needs and we were spoiled with free snacks,  a tradition which Gaborone Sun has maintained since inception.

For tourists this is a place to visit and relax with the locals after working hours and weekends.

 For those of us with good appetite for food this is to place to have your buffet meals which is so generous and inexpensive.

See you at Gaborone Sun

title: family trip
text: The hotel though previously dated has undergone new changes under the AVANI flagship and is now boasting great service and a friendly staff. the rooms are upgraded comfortable with amenities and the room service is splendid the casino and bars are modern with great cocktails.

title: Breathtaking place
text: I had a friend staying there from Cape town, I visited them there, had some cocktails by the pool, the staff were so helpful, the atmosphere so warm

title: Top 4 star hotel
text: But for there being no lift I would have given it 5 stars. This is now in a different group and you can see that it is no longer like a standard Sun hotel. It is now the Avani. You get the impression from the staff and the write ups that they are in the business to help you and make your stay is enjoyable. It starts with the doormen who are helpful who do not look as tho they are looking just for the tip. We had trouble checking in  but this was sorted out by Gotlme Muloije. As we were tired after a very long day we decide to eat in the Montgomery which was excellent. I wrote this up in the restaurant section of The TripAdvisor. The rooms are large and have everything where it should be. The electric sockets have South African and European types. No adapters needed. Very attractive pool and also the  lounges. They have a happy hour from 6.00 pm to 7.00 pm  with 25% discount which saves some money.. Looking at the number of hotels in this group and the cities where they are located they are catering for regular business people. If I were back in business I would certainly see whether this group had a hotel in the city I was going to. Well worth staying at.

title: Avani nee Gaborone sun
text: The food and accommodation at Gaborone sun covers all kinds of people and events.Its restaurant,Oh taste and see that its one of the best restaurant  you may want to your buffet at.

title: Name has changed to Avani Gaberone
text: Currently busy with renovations to some rooms. Not a hindrance though. Peaceful and happy place to stay over. Lovely pool, bar and buffet area/restaurant. Spacious rooms, pool nice and warm this time of year, staff friendly and happy

title: The place is very neat except for the rest room. it needs a bit of refurbisment.
text: a good place after all. I can recommend others to come for a visit or come and have their meetings here service is wow.

title: A good location for those attending conference
text: I attended a conference in Gaborone. Since this took place in the hotel conference centre, I booked a room in the hotel itself. For those on business/conference, it is very suitable- no stress to rush to take shuttle or car to go to your destination but convenient walking distance. The room is okay for short stay and you can take a car to go shopping around. Staff is friendly.

title: On boarding issues
text:
Yet again had problems on boarding:
Remote for AC doesn't work.
No telephone directory.
No room service menu.

I wanted to order food so I can sleep an work later.

This is a great hotel but they always disappoint upon arrival.

Also the reception didn't appear helpful or interested in my problems.

Maybe time to look for another hotel while in Gabarone...

I've always felt that Gaborone Sun, now Avani Hotel, was one of the better hotels in Gaborone. The rooms aren't bad but I feel a lot of the rooms have parts that are outdated and in serious need of an update. I was given a room in the block at the back; the room was amazing (bed, couches, amenities) but the bathroom was a bit dilapidated. I then requested a room closer to the reception; in this case, the room was also great and so was the bathroom but the airconditioner/heater wasn't working. All in all the hotel itself isn't too bad but it would be great if all the rooms in the same price range were uniform.

title: Attendinb a conference at the sun
text: A good hotel for conference with frienly staff.its location was slightly far from the cbd and it is a challenge for those who would wish to sample the night life.its restaourants were packed in the evening with revellers.

title: Good clean and luxury facility
text: The Hotel has been taken over by new owners but is still serve the public well and has good dinning out places and a good pub like restaurant outside next to the pool

title: It is good probably teh best in Gabs esp tehcarvery
text:
I have been here many times
none bette rthan Valentines with my Gracie
It is very westtern and tourists who come here and think they hav eseen Gaborone HAVE not

title: An Oasis in middle of Gaborone
text: Stopped by in the evening after work for darshan. Was made aware that they also serve food during the weekends. Bought some sweets and snacks, which were really authentic in taste. Highly recommended.

title: Best vegetarian food in town
text: The temple is host to Govindas that provides vegetarian/vegan Indian meals. The best choice for Sunday brunch from 9-11:30am. They do daily take always and a Friday night feast!  Their food never disappoints. If you are in town during their food festival- it’s a must visit for a negligible entrance fee of P5. Personally have not been to the temple but I know it’s open to the public.

title: Iscon Temple
text:
This temple is a delight for the Indians as it is only one of its kind in Botswana .
The place has facility for recreational activities, mass prayer, big functions.
It also holds occasional fests and cultural programmes

title: People always welcome you
text: If you have a chance to go to Iskcon, the kitchen is open for some delicious treats, rolls, cakes to order.  Staff are all very friendly and very helpful.

title: For Vegetarians
text: Excellent breakfasts for vegetarians.  This is a temple that welcomes everyone every day.   Food Service is only on Sunday mornings .... good vegetarian breakfasts.

title: Iskcon Temple in city
text:
Iskcon Gaborone is in heart of City. Temple is quiet good, neat and clean. You may come sit and meditate and offer prayer to Lord Krishna and other deity.

I have been there during food festival 2018. During food festival, you may enjoy the taste of typical indian food away from India. Temple also serves sweet, so you may get sweet in temple.

Visit once atleast

title: Beautiful temple
text: This temple is beautiful. Immense care and attention has been paid to the construction and diety.  Run by dedicated people.  Very happy to share their beliefs.

title: Neat and quiet
text: A Neat and quiet place. Well maintained. Not touristy. But if you are into religion, it is worth a visit.

title: Beautiful temple
text:
A  very lovely temple very similar to other ISKON temples,very clean and quiet. 
 They serve Vegetarian Brunch on Sundays  and also sell sweets and savory items.

title: The Paradise of Gaborone.
text:
This is a place where you would like to see very often.It is located in a residential area and i tell you those who are near and are intersted to visit ISKCON are really blessed.Lord Krishna's idol is there and he is lovely and beautiful and when you see him your mind becomes very calm no matter how much ever stress or tension you have.They always give some prasad [Snack item for eating] and on some festival days they give plenty of tasty and quality food with a lot of varities which is cooked there itself by a Special Chef From India.
Finally to sum up i can say ISKON the PARADISE of GABORONE.

title: Excellent Pure Vegetarian Food
text:
If you would like to have a great Pure Vegetarian Brunch on Sundays, Look no other place excepting this.  With the great background of the unique temple structure behind, you will enjoy well done, tasty brunch (menu changes every week!).
Of course, if you are conducting functions they offer special meal service.  Also if you need special sweets and savories, this is the best place for you.  Most importantly the money you spent here will be helping volunteers to maintain the beautiful place, is the bonus on your Selfish-reslishing spending!

title: Good
text: Quiet place in a crowded locality. Very serene, very clean. Just the place to sit down a while and refresh one self.

title: The aura is magnificent - peaceful and beautiful
text:
I have started coming to this place because it always has a positive vibrations to it. The temple hall itself is truly beautiful and the best part is everyone is welcome. I am told this place is not only a place of worship for Indian people but, is more on the spiritual platform that talks about bhakti yoga practises. 

I highly rate this place as a place of Zen. Also the food is absolutely delicious. Expect to get a free meal every Sunday afternoon at 1300hrs or Sunday evening at 1900hrs, depending on the season. 

The best thing I experienced here was the Diwali Food festival. The food was great, the people were great and the atmosphere was vibrant.

photos.caption: My sister and I visiting the temple

title: Beautiful and scerene
text: Beautiful Krishna Temple - everyone is welcome and the teachers are ready to tell you about their deity and the beliefs that accompany them.  On certain days you can purchase traditional foods at very reasonable prices.  Lovely serene environment.

title: Rejuvenating place
text: Been rehearsing in the choir at the ISCKON building for ISKCON's 50th celebrations held on the 4th June,2016 and intertained the audience on the day. the food has been great, not talking about the warm welcome from the ISCKON members.

photos.caption: Thats an old lady enjoying herself at inside the ISCKON building
Enjoying myself recently at ISCKON gardens
Having a good and relaxed weekend at ISCKON

title: Peace, Prayers & Food
text: A visit to ISKCON temple, which is very close to Gaborone CBD gets you to a smooth start for a Sunday Morning.  You can experience the peaceful atmosphere there, enjoy the exquisite Architecture and if you are a believer of GOD, do prayer and meditate.  They have recently started the Sunday Breakfast, which is priced right.  They offer good vegetarian meal to start the day.

title: ISKON temple
text: new ISKON temple built in Gaborone. The prayer meetings end with food offered free by the temple. all the work done including making of food is done voluntary by the devoteees

title: Splendor of Iskcon
text: A very pleasant visit, Beautiful paintings of the 10 Avatars of the LORD. There are some beautiful sculptures as well.

title: Quick visit to the temple
text: During my stay in Gabarone, i took one evening to go the temple for to go for some spiritual time. The temple is neat and clean and it is really beautiful inside.  It is a must for all hindus to visit when in Gabarone.

title: Wow , Woh and Wow ....
text:
What an architecture and has been well planned and designed. Be it temple, boundary wall or the garden.
Thanks to Mr Koshal and his team for their gift to Gaborone.
Best temple in Gaborone

title: Nice temple
text: Nice Temple with Nice Management. Enjoyed different hindu festivals in this temple and one Food Festival

title: Peaceful & Calm Environment..
text: The temple has very quite and peaceful environment. The temple is nicely constructed. The prayers to Lord Krishna starts at 7:00 pm daily. They also offer prasadam (lunch or dinner) on pre-order basis

title: Uma visita diferente na Africa!!
text: Fomos visitar o templo ISKCON (Sociedade Internacional para a Consciência do Hinduísmo/Centro Hare Krishna de Bhakti Yoga) O templo ISKCON Botswana situa-se em Gaborone. É um bonito templo que atraiu muitas pessoas de todas as partes do país para ver sua magnífica obra de arte que pode ser vista no exterior e especialmente no interior do templo, onde não se pode fotografar. O templo é a casa de Sri Sri Kirishna e Balarama. Lugar agradável, bem cuidado, limpo e com pessoas muito simpáticas para atende-lo. Vale a pena fazer essa visita.

title: A little of history and beautiful scenery, our own Ayer’s rock in Africa.
text:
We took a little detour on our trip to Maun. The mountains of the Gods.
The locals have respect and this is a sacred place for them. We had a great guide that gave us a good overview of the history. He also took us on a hike and showed us bushmen paintings.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: an overall marvelous experience, especially the camp site.
text: hill climbing and sightings of rock painting.This is  a UNESCO world heritage site . i marvelously enjoyed the foot trails as well as the short drive from the tarred road. The access road from the gate was a bit of a challenge because of the wet season but it was nothing that  my 4x4  couldnt handle.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Lots of walking
text: This is a stunning area and a UNESCO world heritage site. There is plenty of parking and trails to follow which are interesting in their own right but lead to the ancient cave paintings. It's worth having a guide to point out the drawings and identify what they are. All very accessible. There is a little museum but don't expect much of that.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Art History
text: I love ancient cave and rock art.  The 3+ hour drive from Maun was worth it. The paintings are easily accessible from the footpath and as clear as if they had been painted last week.  The guide was knowledgeable and made sure we did not miss anything.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Remarkable art in a place of spiritual significance.
text: This UNESCO site is well worth the visit despite the short rough road from the highway. There are several trails that include multiple rock art paintings. We had an excellent guide and did the Rhino Trail, which has 16 viewpoints. This trail also takes one up to the top and along a ridge for views, if you wish. There are fantastic depictions of antelope, rhinos, zebra, tortoises, and even a whale and penguin in these paintings, some of over 4500 in the area. The museum has excellent explanations of the life and history of the people who did the art – and the spiritual significance of the mountains as well.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Nice if you want to hike. Not worth a trip just for the museum.
text: Driving from Shakawe on a long, bad gravel road for 1,5 hours. Guides offer different trails, most 2 hours long. We did the rhino trail for P120 estimated 2 hours. Not too strenuous and good rock art viewings. Lion, summit and cliff trail were P175.  Entrance was P50 pp which goes to the community and your walk fee goes to the guide (although 1 guide tried to tell us the walk fee went to the community - we got a different guide and he explained that's not how it works so I think the first guide was trying to make extra tips). There is a campsite there but the ablutions were awful so I wouldn't stay there.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: going to great trouble
text: the site, the paintings, the museum, very good to excellent, BUT to get there is a mission. 2/3 of the access road is badly corrugated shaking the vehicle to pieces and forcing one to travel at very slow speed. The 30 odd km take a good hour, so 2 hours are gone for the return trip. The nearest accommodation is far away hence the time available for actually enjoying and studying the site is vastly reduced. The upkeep of the ablutions and overall area is poor, and it being a UNESCO heritage site it's disgraceful and, overall our impression was a big disappointment.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Remarkable site, bringing us closer to our ancestors
text: The hills, overlooking the Kalahari are the home of the San people for millenia.  There are wall paintings, still vivid after 2,000 years, of the wildlife they encountered.  In addiiton, there are later paintings, pehraps 1,500 years old, displaying the domestic animals - perhaps a sign of moving from hunting-gathering to agriculture?  The guides are well-informed Bushmen, as was our guide from our Lodge.  They demonstrated their langauge and different dialects, with various "clicks" as we walked through the hills.  There are several paths, ranging from an easy 2-hour journey to a more strenous 4 hour hike.  Because we are nearing 80, the guides deiced on the asy path for us.  We still saw an abundance of paintings and it really was easy.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Great bit of history
text:
A great site to visit with the guides very helpful and knowledgable.
The rock paintings where stunning.
Various lengths of walk available to suit most people.
Tip.....don’t walk at midday if possible as the heat was oppressively hot.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Tsodilo
text: Lopang, our guide, was exceptional. He is warm hearted, enthusiastic and well informed. 4 star service.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: So beautiful...the colour of the rocks, the paintings and the energy!
text:
What a wonderful trip we had to Tsodilo Hills!
First of all we were abit worried about the road condition as we did not have 4x4 and the sand they said could turn tricky after the evening rain and thunderstorm.  Luckily, we had no problem whatsoever.
We arrived at the gate at 7.30am so as to avoid the heat of midday. Again we were lucky. It was slightly overcast throughout our walk.  If you want to go on one of the longer trails, I think, it is important to arrive early because it can get extremely hot.
All 4 of us are senior citizens and I suffer from vertigo so we did not want a strenuous uphill hike, just an hour's walk to see a few of the San paintings and to feel the energy of these Holy hills. 
Our guide LOPANG was excellent. Such a sweet boy, he understood exactly what we wanted and gave us a wonderful 1hr hike at the bottom of Female Hill - the so called Rhino Trail.
More than anything, I was amazed by the beautiful colours of the rocks, the pastel pinks and oranges and creams, so breathtakingly beautiful.
Definitely worth a visit and definitely worth having Lopang with you.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Impressive Place
text: Belongs to the area and Botswana history. The road is bumpy and needs slow drives. The guides are well coached and explained a lot, asked all questions very professional. Midcut hiking shoes are needed, sun protection and hat 🧢 are recommended. Lunchtime isn‘t such busy, so less groups are there.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: remote but worth it.
text: 40kms drive on dirt but quite exceptional bit of history. we ran out of time so only saw the main features but there is lots to do

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Used to be better
text:
Tsodilo used to be one of my favorite spots as a child. You had free reign of the entire place. As kids we would climb up and crawl through everything.
These days however it's a different story. Camping used to be free, which was great because you had to bring all your own gear. Now however they have started charging a lot of money to camp in a place that offers very little. The ablutions have not worked properly in 20 years and still don't even though they now charge to stay there. Where we used to be able to hike around Tsodilo by ourselves we now have to pay guides to take us to places that we know as well as they do.
Unfortunately I have now stopped going to Tsodilo as it's just not worth it anymore.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Tsodilo Hills
text: The guided tour along the Rhino path included hundreds of original hand painted pictures of the local African wildlife on the rock faces. Our guide took us up to the upper portion of the Female Hill and pointed out where the ancient locals lived.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Fantastic rock art
text: It was hot, very hot, so we didn't do too much of the walking tour and one of the best bits was actually the drive there and seeing all the wildlife and giving lifts to a few locals who couldn't have been more appreciative.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: In the camping at night pierce the wheels
text: In the camping at night pierce the wheels.We stood alone, there were no other cars. The territory is fenced, but the place is not safe.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Stunning
text: This World Heritage Site is a sacred place for the San people and the rock art is amazing.  We followed the Rhino Trail which is mostly flat with just one small area of rocks to climb over.  Anyone would be able to see some of the work.  A small museum is attached to the site and washroom facilities.  There is no cafe.  We took a picnic for our lunch having driven from Shakawe where we stayed on a houseboat.  This was an optional excursion as part of our Explore holiday.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Beautiful place but tour was poor
text:
The Tsodilo Hills is a unique place and a Unesco World Heritage Site.  It holds a lot of promise, but I don't think the guides are sufficiently trained to add real value to what could be a very interesting and enjoyable visit.
Quite out the way, and very hot - even in Winter.  Bring water and a sun hat.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Destination of the gods
text:
Although it was a hot August day and the walk was quite tiring, it was well worth it. The rock art and the colour splendour of the rocks and the mountain was amasing. Our guide was so well informed and patient with us, answering all our questions efficiently.
This historical site is a must visit.
The recreation area needs attention. We were eager to have a picnic there were so much flies. Seating was very limited.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Special
text: A very special place. Very different of the rest of the Okavango region. Well worth a visit. The guide was pleasant and informative. Without him we would have missed most of the art.   Road not great.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Wow wow!
text: Amazing place! So much history and so beautiful at the same time. The paintings are incredible. Our guide Alec was very knowledgeable and told us many interesting stories about the hills, Sun people etc. We really enjoyed our afternoon there. Really worth to visit.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: no longer free to go there and guide not very interested
text: In the lonely planet tjhey tellyou that this place is very special and a must see. And that this holy place for the San can be visited for free. The last is no longer true. We arrived over a quite well kept gravel road and found a gate now with a very unfriendly lady who told us that we had to pass the gate to the campsite, the gate to the hills, also there ,had been closed. I do not know why. We had to pay a quite high entrance fee , just to go to the empty campsite that we did not need and had to search for the road to the trails. We passed some very bad paths and reached a new build center wher a very enthusiastic man told us that the government had decided that the local village people had to earn money from the tourists that came to visit their wholy place. Do you pay for visiting the St Peter or the golden mosk or other wholy places? Yes i payed for visiting a buddhist temple in Bali and felt robbed too. We also had to take a guide because , as the man told us, the tourists often damaged the place when they walked there alone. We got a young man as a guide who hardly spoke English and seemed very annoyed to do this task. We are not very young anymore and he told us we had to go the other way around as the most easy trail, the rhino trail, still was very difficult. We indeed saw very interesting drawings , not carfed in the rocks as in Namibia at twyfelfontein, but really painted on it with some mixture of blood roots etc. The paintings are red. Also the surroundings were very beautiful but the path was indeed very difficult to walk, or better climb. One of us hardly could come down the very steep and rocky hills.The guide did not offer him any help and walked on in front of us without even looking. I would not recommend this walk . And the eager of local villagers to earn is bigger than their eager to welcome you and help you. I guess that the spirits of their ancestors are not happy with the behavior of this new generation. Overall I think that visiting the place is not worth the long journey and the money.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Worst campsite in Botswana
text:
We booked 7 days camping at Tsodilo Hills Community campsite as all other sites were fully booked. The plan was to use this as a base camp from where we can explore the upper Western part of Botswana. They charged a ridiculous price of 140 Pula per person per day, which is around R 190 South African Rand.
On arrival, there was no one at the main gate. I opened the gate myself and only then did people come running out the bush trying to sell us curios and offered to wash my Landy. We were told to wait for the person who will assist us with our booking. After approx. 20 minutes the person arrived. I gave her our proof of payment, and as we were already 2 days late , she wanted to refund the 2 days camping that we lost. I told her not to worry about that, as it was my fault that we were late. When we got to our campsite it was strewn with litter, the rubbish bin was overflowing with rubbish, used toilet paper all over. The ablutions were even worse. Rubbish all over the place and it looked like an Elephant had used the shower just before we came. Mud everywhere. I then noticed that non of the toilets had seats. We decided to take a drive around the UNESCO World Heritage Site while deciding what to do about the camping. While driving around the hills we decided not to stay in the campsite. On exiting the community site, i told the lady that we were very unhappy with this place and we decided not to stay there. She got extremely upset about our leaving, and she promised that they would go clean everything during the coarse of the day. I flatly refused and then she got really upset. She said that we now owe her another 200 Pula as we entered the Tsodilo Hills National Park. This after we already paid 1400 Pula?? I refused to pay and also informed her that i want all my money back, which she now refused. So we just left and found a spot at Shakawe, Drotskys Cabins and Camping right next to the swamps. We did lay a complaint at the Tourism Board in Maun, so we will see what happens and i hope we will get a full refund.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Beautiful and special
text: This is a beautiful place with loads of history. Day fees are P50. Have to get a guide also to walk the rhino trial with you! Beautiful caves and bush/woods!

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Road very slippery in rain strike
text:
The hills are beautiful their location spectacular.
We were told 3 times the access road to the national park was good for 2 wheel drive which it was on the 25th dec when it was dry. light rain in the morning apparently
when we went there on the 26th it had poured down and the road was very slippery the vehicle sliding across the road  on numerous occasions.
it took an hour to drive back and was horrid.
the road from the park gate to the base of the hills museum and guides office was ok in the dry but on the 26th 2 wheel drive vechicles had to be towed out.
we went on the rhino walk which was a mixture of beautiful rock art including the sir lauren van de post wall. The guide touched the paintings. Some rock shelters where we were told stone age people would have sheltered with out any evidence or commentry about the research. we walked to the ridge where one could see the kalahari and the delta.
Then shown some pottery fragments set in a circle with some bone. told these were evidence of trading.
A water buffulo tread in rock from when the rock was soft and animals could talk. etc.

when we slipped and slid to the gates in the morning of the 26th the woman who was supposed to be there at 7 was no where to be seen didn't appear untill at least 8.30 by that time there was one vechicle waiting to leave and three waiting to get in
the place is beautiful the art astounding the site badly managed by the local community the guides not well trained the walks a mix of beauty and disney.
id go again tomorrow( in a 4x4 if it was wet) do my own research (books avaliable at craft shop opposite Maun airport terminal) and ignore the guide.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: interesting
text: Very interesting landscape. Amazing amount of rock art. Be prepared for some strenous walking. I advise hiring a knowledgable guide.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Better than expected based on TA reviews
text: Went with a guide from our lodge but needed to go with a local guide assigned there.....he was a San Bushman having grown up on the mt.  He offered a great tour and interpretation of the paintings.  So glad we went.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Fascinating
text: Some of the ancient cave paintings are so clear and bright it's hard to believe their age. Local guide was informative. The geology of the area is also very impressive.

photos.caption: Local guide points out some of the cave paintings.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Disgraceful amenities
text: This world heritage site has been handed over to the local community who rakes in over 1 million Dollars a year and treats their tourists in the most disgraceful manner.  While the  site itself is awesome, the campsite (only accommodation for miles) has been utterly abandoned by this greedy community.  The ablutions have never been cleaned, but how would one know as they are too cheap to even replace the light bulb.  Many hundreds of people pass through this camp site including large school groups but not one person has ever felt that making tourists, who have flown in from around the world to enjoy the experience, feel more comfortable.  Regrettably I brought my torch, as the ablutions are pitch dark even in daylight, and was disgusted at the lack of respect for those that foot the 1 million dollar bill annually.  Shame on the community.  We were told that we must take a tour guide to visit the hills and may not go on our own.  The guides told us that they come on duty at 07h30 in the morning.  At 08h30 we were ready for our tour but everyone had disappeared - probably to have their breakfast, so we went on our own.  It took about 2,5 hours to do the round trip but it was pretty tough going.  I suggest that you take 2 days to see Tsodilo Hills.  Stay at the excellent Drotsky's camping and accommodation and drive during the day to see the Hills.  It is a reasonable distance so it makes sense to do it over 2 days and enjoy Drotsky's river side haven. Tsodilo Hills camp site is a disgusting site and should be boycotted till the community gets some respect for their tourists.  However please bring some food for the starving 3 legged dog as the over fed locals have not even scraps for "Ole 3 Leg".

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
placeInfo.address: Near Sepupa Northwest Botswana, Shakawe Botswana

title: Glimpse of history in the bush
text: An interesting half day trip from Drotsky's Cabins. George the guide gave plenty of information about the cave paintings and the people who painted them. Saw plenty of birds and reptiles and ate juicy marula fruit. Well worth the drive.

placeInfo.name: Tsodilo Hills
