title: Rip offs
text: They are rip offs! You have to buy a full year membership to drive around the park with your own car. This rule isn’t communicated in their website at all, so we drove all the way here for nothing.

title: Peaceful break away
text: Mokolodi is a peaceful place to spend hours in nature. The restaurant is amazing and you can just sit and watch the animals or even an amazing sunset. So many things to do. The snake park and animal sanctuary is also a very impressive visit. Definitely the place to go to recharge your batteries and appreciate nature.

title: Extremely uninteresting
text: Exactly one year after the first time, we came here again since our year pass was coming to an end. This time we saw literally not one single mamal in the whole park! And again we couldn't believe that they mark SOME roads as 4x4 only. We drive a brand new Landrover and I can assure you you need a 4x4 for every single road in the park. And moreover they are so badly kept that you get scratches all over your car from branches and risk punctures at all the stony roads. And for what doing the trouble: there is nothing to see. We did hear the restaurant isn't bad but it was closed so we could not try that. But the "park" itself is rubish. Utterly rubish. Please note that I have written 2700 reviews here and there aren't many with a 1 dot note.....

title: Business meeting - Lunch
text: Mokolodi is the perfect place for one-on-on Meeting interventions. Staff are super great and the food absolutely great and good value for money.

title: Excellent camping stopover
text:
We camped here on our final night in Botswana. We didn't do any game drives as such as needed to set up our camp, but we did see quite a few animals just going to the camp site area! 
The staff at reception were just so so friendly and helpful. we had to have our covid tests printed and they sorted for us, and also had a connection at the labs, as one of our tests hadn't come through, and they called them, after hours to assist us. They really went out of the way to help us.

The campsite was clean and rustic. lovely stopover if you need to stay in Gaborone.

title: Good Place
text: A good place to spend quality time away from town, i recommend to family and friends, the roads are not as good though

title: Awful roads and no animals
text: We spent a full day driving all of the roads, seeing very few animals (yes, including birds) but what bothered us the most was that the roads were so terrible that even in our Landrover it was bad. Even roads not indicated as 4x4 roads exclusively were effectively only good for 4x4, and it was a nice dry day. So bushy you cannot see an impala if it's 3 meters far... And we have driven all over Botswana so we can compare! We only saw 7 species of mammals and to drive yourself you need to buy a year permit of 700 pula. Seeing the cheetahs and reptiles costs extra.

title: EXCELLENT VALUE
text:
We had a lovely visit (with a vehicle to ourselves) accompanied by our lady game ranger.  We didn't see as much as we had hoped but not for want of trying.  Plenty of muti-varieties of deer, wart hogs, baboons, vultures, etc.  It was lovely to get out in the African bush again, to hear the sounds - you are never sure what's around the next corner!  Thank you for a great visit.  
Very good value too.  Your hotel will order a car for you and the driver will either wait or come back to collect you.

title: Lovely location close to city
text: Was on a game drive but only saw Impala and Kudo but the Bush Braai was excellent and the young girl who was our guide was first class. Well worth a visit.

title: Excellent Nature Reserve at Low cost near Gaborone
text:
As we entered we saw a huge Giraffe then plenty of Imphala's some Zebras, wild beast,water hog Kudus some birds and some Hen like variety.The Lady Guide  explained each and everything patiently.Hats off to her.
4x4 organised by The Nature Reserve can accommodate 15 Adults.Some of them had come from South Africa and some from Europe they all also enjoyed as it is such a lovely place very near from the Capital at a very very low cost.
There are different activities like Cheetah Visit,Rhino tracking which are really Great and Bush Braai which is Game drive in the dark then Dinner like organised by The Nature Reserve.
Each of them have their respective rates but they are very economical and I am sure you will feel Great as they give more than enough for the money they take from you.To sum up Mokolodi Nature Reserve a must visit spot.

title: Seemed Like it has fallen on hard times
text: My colleagues who have been to Botswana for work told me I must go there afterwork one day.  It was okay but just okay.  The only animals we saw were giraffes.  I was told there was a watering hole near the restaurant and the animals came to it at sunset. This is NOT true.  The guide (Pinot) seemed fairly knowledgeable but there was just nothing to see.  which for all the animals that Pinot said that they had on property seems VERY unusual

title: Great trip close to Gaborone
text:
We arranged for an afternoon two hour game drive.  The disappointing aspect was the lack of animals that we were unable to see.  It was afternoon, it was hot and they dont turn up on order!  That said, we saw different types of antelope and warthog families with really cute babies.  The trip included what the driver referred to as an 'African massage'.  Basically the transportation and the terrain means it is a very shaky ride.  There was only our group of three on the drive so we had plenty of room and good interaction with the guide.  He really tried to find some animals for us to see.

We booked a taxi from the hotel to take us there and arranged a time for them to pick us up.  It only took about half an hour from the hotel each way so not much wasted time.  Overall it was good trip, lots of flora and fresh air and very inexpensive.

title: Game Drive
text: We have the 2 hours game drive. All the staff was very friendly and the service and food at the restaurant was great. When my wife  or any other of my family members comes to visit I will definitely time them their.

title: Beautiful place to visit
text: We had a wonderful game drive with a very friendly driver - followed this up with dinner at the restaurant while our child played in the Playarea. Staff were very friendly and even recommended their best dishes.

title: Mokolodi Chalets
text: I have spent New Years Eve at Mokolodi a few time now, love the peace and quiet and watching the sunset over the waterhole that the chalets overlook. There is plenty of animals to see. Its only a short drive to the restaurant if you don't fancy catering for your self. My family were out from the UK so we spent two very enjoyable nights there.

photos.caption: Having a brunch out in the bush.

title: Explore
text: We saw quite a few animals like Zebras Giraffe. Kudu Impala Monkeys N some nice birds. The only bad things is that it was very hot and the rooms don't have aircon. But the tour guide was very kind and funny.

title: Organized trip
text: Time of visit few animals, was told  in the winter  months  there are more animals. Best time to visit  June to  August.

title: Ideal if you have limited time
text: I visited on a Friday afternoon, and was pretty much the only person here. The standard cost is 150BWP, but as the default is two people for a trip in the jeep, it cost me 300BWP. However, it was well worth it, my guide pointed out animals and birds that I'd probably not have noticed, and was helpful and patient with me. I saw a giraffe, impalas, hippos (in the distance, admittedly), a fish-eagle, and various others. Because I had limited time I asked my guide that the trip be about an hour and a half, and she kept to that.

title: Great reserve
text: The place is great. The truck is big and the road inside the reserve is bumpy it needs someone to hold the kids tight as they can fell inside the truck.It is wise to visit the reserve in winter because in summer they are scarce due to rain, eg in our 2 hrs drive around the reserve, we only saw impalas and giraffes only.

title: A gem suprisingly close to town
text:
I visited this reserve whilst having a day off while working in Gaborone.  The reserve itself is only about 15 minutes out of town on the main route south of the city.   It is not a big place, but it does have a fair few animals in there.  If you are looking for the "big Five" you wont find them here, but you will find a lot of Impala, Kudu, Warthogs, Giraffe etc.  I went round the park on the back of a truck.  The tracks are pretty rough so be prepared to be knocked around a bit.  

The place was very dry, it having not rained for many months, but this made it easier to see the animals as there was not a lot of cover obstructing them.  

I enjoyed my time there, got to see a fair bit of wildlife as well.  There is a reptile area, with snakes and tortoises that have been rescued or removed from danger,  on site.  I like snakes so it was great to see so many up close.  

I finished the visit with lunch at the onsite restaurant.  overall it was a great way to spend half a day.  If in Gaborone and wondering what to do, then I suggest a quick drive south to Mokolodi

title: Amazing
text: If game drive is your thing then Mokolodi Nature Reserve is the right place. Great experience, experienced staff. Amazing view from all aspects

title: Great place
text: This is a wildlife preserve close to Gabarone.  It gives you the opportunity to see a variety of wildlife in their natural state the staff is excellent and knowledgeable

title: Safari
text: The area was good however did not see many animals, did see a few. Very scenic, sunsets are great, took a lot of pictures.

title: Wow! What a Great Place!
text: We had no idea what was in store for us as we bumped down a rough road for what seemed like miles in search of our "home" for the next two nights. But it was wonderful. We sat on the porch and watched giraffes, kudu, rhinos, impala, and many other animals and birds come to drink at the lake that lay before us. And oh the quiet! All too soon it was time to pack up and leave. I'd go back in a heart beat.

title: Great Outing
text: I must recommend the night drive and bush braai.  After a long drive and a stop for sunset viewing and a beverage, the knowledgeable driver next drove us to the boma where we sat around a fire under the stars talking and sipping wine. The barbecue was pretty average but still good value for money. A good arrangement.

title: Visit to Mokolodi
text: Mokolodi is close to Gaborone and is easily accessible via the Lobatse road. It is less than 40min drive from Gaborone and you will enjoy the scenery.

title: One with Nature!!!
text: beautiful restaurant where you can have your food while watching zebras, warthogs, kudus while they graze. the staff is soooooooooo friendly and the food and cocktails amazing!!!! will go back again

title: Loud parties at night
text: I visited Mokolodi Nature Reserve a week ago. The place itself is good but there was a group of people camping playing loud music all night long. Absolutely appalling. No guards, management or else shut them down or kick them off the camp. Absolutely awful. This carried on all night-long. When I went next morning to complain at reception the very kind staff told me that they had received a lot of complaints already. However these people still were within the Reserve. Shocking. I wrote an email of complaint and the CEO replied stating that this they do not permit this...but it went on for 24hrs, since I got to camp in the afternoon, throughout the night and next morning... APPALLING, annoying. Do not recommend the place for it seems to allow drunken parties with loud music. Won´t be returning EVER. Hope they actually do something to avoid these happenings and the place does not turn into a brothel. I am brutally honest. I am recommending the place for loud lousy alcohol & drugs parties, not for a nature experience.

title: Great first wildlife experience in Botswana
text: Fantastic first wildlife experience in Botswana! Friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere and great sightings!  Got to see White Rhino, giraffe, warthog, kudu, impala, zebra & ostrich!

title: Wow, what a lovely place run by beautiful people
text:
We went for an afternoon game drive.
The driver/guide was awesome (Eddy). The animals were plentiful and it was good value.
For a bonus, it's just a short drive on tar to get there.
The staff generally are so friendly and awesome, I'll go back whenever I can!

title: Mokolodi Nature Reserve
text: Fantastic! Saw mother rhino & 18month baby; mother rhino & 5 month baby; giraffe; wildebeest; warthog; impala; zebras; heron. Bumpy ride but totally worth it.

title: A Date With The Wilderness
text: Arrived as they were about to hit the Game Drive but they were kind enough to wait for us. We saw lovely animals being Zebras, Antelopes, Steenbok, Kudu, White Rhino, Warthog etc. I was hoping to see the cats but they hid from us. A lovely outing with a wonderful guide. Will do it again

title: Fantastic dinner
text: i had fantastic dinner at Mokolodi with my colleagues. The food was so tasty and the Chef was on spot

title: Lovely game drive
text: I had a wonderful time on a game drive here. The guide was patient and persistent to make sure we saw as much as possible. The giraffes were incredible. There were 10 in a group, just hanging around. I saw wart hogs, eland, kudu, impala, rhino, and vultures. Good for families since it isn't far from Gaborone, but also a good respite from your business trip.

title: super amazing
text: I would like to say a big thanks to all of the team for there help and all there work while we were there. The food was excellent and they did there best to give us what we wanted when requested. The guide was excellent and even though he has fished often as he is mainly based at the his knowledge of Mahseer is excellent and he defiantly contributed to my catches.The driver was very good and we felt safe on the scary roads and always very attentive.The camp manager was very friendly and the porter did a very good job even though he is still learning.

title: Rhino trek is a wonderful experience
text:
With only a morning/afternoon to explore before our flight out of Gabs, our hotel concierge suggested Mokolodi.  He then made the call and reserved the Rhino trek for us at $65 per person.

We arranged a taxi to pick us up at 6:30am to make the 7:30 check-in time.  This gave us about 10 spare minutes.  Going rate is P400 ($40) each way.

The Rhino trek started on an open-air truck.  This was in June when in was winter in Botswana, and it was a little cold on the ride out.  We drove around for 30-45 minutes, stopping a few times as the guides found tracks and used the directional radio to try and find the Rhinos.  Eventually we dismounted the truck, and walked about 1-2 kilometers into the bush.  Definitely recommend hiking shoes and long pants.

We came up on the Rhino, and there's no describing being about 15 meters from such a huge creature, with no barriers or gates or fences.  Just a guide with a very flimsy looking rifle (maybe to shoot one of us so the rest get away?).

This is well worth a trip; it's really a once in a lifetime sort of thing, and a great way to see 1 of the big 5 if you don't have a lot of spare time to go deep into the bush, or fly north toward Maun or Kasane.

title: Worth the visit
text:
We had a free afternoon and decided to visit this game reserve.
Its not anywhere in comparison to the big game reserves like Kruger but its worth the visit since there is not much to do in Gaborone.
The booking was done by our hotel but I am pretty sure they accept walk in.
The ride was a bit uncomfortable since they dont have paved roads.
They dont have elephants and lions in the reserve.
We saw a lot of impala and warthogs. We also saw a lone kudu and 3 rhinos.
Snacks and cold drinks were provided during the 2 hour ride.
It was a pleasant way to spend the afternoon but if you expect it to be like the big parks then you will be dissapointed.

title: Very impressed
text: We used it for an overnight stay on our recent trip but soon realised that there is so much to see and do that one could easily stay for two or more nights. We stayed in one of the chalets and it had everything you need for your stay. Clean and well maintained. The staff is efficient and friendly. Overall this place has a great peaceful vibe which lends itself to a relaxing stay. We will certainly use it again.

title: My experience at Mokolodi Nature Reserve
text: The place is a lovely and you get to have game drive to see various animals and birds and also the nice breeze.

title: Unwind on the outskirts of Gabs
text:
Mokolodi is very ideal for those who love to spend time out of town on a quite place and yet taking a great sight at the landscape of hills and mountains surrounding the area. 

It gives peace of mind looking at the animals they keep and looking at the sunset when you camp. Oh well once you in the park you are marveled by a view of Giraffes and Zebras. 

Excellent place to be if you need to unwind out of town abit.

title: Safari feel close to the city
text: Mokolodi is an ideal nature reserve closer to Gaborone city. Nice view from the hill top and a relaxing feel near the dam inside the reserve. It was an awesome adventure costing cheaper. We saw impalas, zebra and some warthogs. Bush braai along the dam site was fabulous

title: A place to relax from the hustle and bustle
text: I always find it is a good time for a good lunch, a slow drive looking for animals or parking by the dam listening to the Hippos. Very  relaxing after a busy weak.

title: Affordable Safari Experience close to the City
text: Have been for an hours  Game drive and Bush Braai, amazing cuisine, the never disappoint. The do not have the big five but its a great tour none the less, the guide was great . Also go for lunch on Saturdays with the family.

title: Disappointing
text:
We probably should have trusted our guts (and the Trip Advisor reviews).  Mokolodi just isn’t worth the visit.  Fortunately, it doesn’t cost a lot so we weren’t out that much financially for such a disappointing time.  Since neither the website nor the brochures will tell you, it’s P150 per person for a 2-hour game drive (at time of writing, about $15US or $19CDN) It’s a shame, since they claim their goals are education and conservation...but I just can’t recommend it as a destination.

The pros:  the mostly outdoor restaurant is super cute, clean, reasonably priced and the food was tasty.  The service was friendly and efficient.

The cons:  (1) as so many other reviewers have mentioned- the lack of animals.  I completely understand that on any type of “safari “ or game drive, you’re at the mercy of circumstances.  But there should at least be signs of animals....tracks, dung.... strangely, not here.  It kind of makes you wonder.  In 2 hours we saw mere glimpses of 1 zebra, a few warthogs, and maybe 5 impala dashing away in the distance.  There was a giraffe eating leaves and almost completely hidden by the trees, although that fleeting and obscured view of gold & brown spots was probably the “highlight” of our excursion. There were 2 hippos almost completely submerged in a watering hole.  (Yes, I know....that’s what hippos do) There was next to no narration by the “guide”.  Nothing about the vegetation (since that’s really all we saw). Only on the handful of occasions we almost saw an animal did she speak up with a 30 second blurb - although we couldn’t hear her at the back of the vehicle anyway. To market this as a place offering game drives is really overselling it.

(2) the vehicle- the vehicle you are driven around in for 2 hours  over extremely rocky, unmaintained trails has virtually no suspension.  It was bumpy beyond  belief.  You will be jostled and bounced and slammed around the entire time.  We weren’t expecting luxury but we certainly weren’t expecting this degree of discomfort.  Ladies, be sure to wear a tight sports bra to harness your bosom.  Honestly, I’m not kidding.  Your butt will also be sore by the time they finally let you off.  If you’re tall, you won’t be able to see out of the vehicle because the roll of the canopy roof hangs down and obscures your view.  On the bright side, see (1) above - no animals.  

Fortunately, we had done several beautiful, successful, photo-worthy, animal-filled and information-filled game drives elsewhere on our trip and the Mokolodi experience isn’t the one that will colour our vacation memories.

(3) The gift shop - Sadly, they’re really missing the boat here.  Given the goals of the operation, I was prepared to drop some cash at a gift shop to pump some money into conservation efforts.  There was virtually nothing to choose from.  Some skilled attention to stocking appealing (or any) inventory would go a long way.

There are other experiences available at Mokolodi and I can’t comment on those.  (Bush braais, rhino tracking, giraffe tracking) Maybe they are better.  They likely can’t be worse.

title: Champagne Brunch and Speedy Game drive
text: We booked a Champagne Brunch which comes with a Game drive. The Guide through the park which was a little annoying as we could not enjoy the surrounding scenery. The Brunch was a little disappointing.
